news_header: Flash flooding in Spain caused significant destruction, resulting in at least 95 deaths. Emergency services are actively working to manage the aftermath.
news_text: Flash flooding in Spain has led to widespread destruction, with cars and debris scattered in the streets. Emergency services worked overnight to clear water from affected areas. Drone footage revealed a partially collapsed road as water continued to surge. In the aftermath, Spanish flags were lowered to half-mast to honor the 95 lives lost. Meanwhile, in Georgia, the government secured nearly 54% of the vote in the recent elections, amidst claims of irregularities. In Russia, President Putin addressed the media following a summit, while a tragic attack in Turkey resulted in five fatalities. Other news includes a high-profile trial involving Gisèle Pelicot, a dissident's vow to return to Russia after being freed, and severe weather events causing fatalities and destruction across Europe.
